meanings.definition: Photographs transmitted by wire for immediate reproduction.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper received the wirephotos of the event just in time for the morning edition.
meanings.sent2: I love looking at old wirephotos of historical moments in newspapers.
meanings.sent3: The wirephotos of the cat wearing a hat made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a collection of wirephotos, capturing every detail of the past.
meanings.sent5: The wirephotos of the sunset were so vivid, it felt like being there.

meanings.definition: To transmit photographs by wire for immediate reproduction.
meanings.sent1: The journalist wirephotos the breaking news to the editor for the front page.
meanings.sent2: They always wirephotos the images to the press before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: I will wirephotos the pictures of the party as soon as I get them developed.
meanings.sent4: His words wirephotos the emotions of the moment better than any picture could.
meanings.sent5: She wirephotos her memories to her grandchildren through old photographs.
